entry.title: Microsoft Outage Draws Criticism From Crypto Community, Is Shiba Inu The Answer?
entry.summary:
The team behind Shiba Inu recently took a swipe at Microsoft, one of the largest companies in the world. Microsoft just had the largest IT outage in history on Friday, July 19. Businesses around the world were grappling with a shutdown due to a Microsoft shutdown that occurred from a glitch. The outage came through CrowdStrike, a cybersecurity platform which experienced an issue during a software update. This interruption affected critical sectors and businesses, including the London Stock Exchange, airlines, banks, and doctors’ offices.
George Kurtz, CEO of CrowdStrike, asserts that the problem has been identified and a solution has been implemented. However, the crash brought to light one of the issues surrounding centralized cloud infrastructure. If anything, it showed how major busi…

entry.title: Spot Ethereum ETFs: Cboe Announces Official Launch Date For These 5 Funds
entry.summary:
After a long period of speculation and uncertainty, Spot Ethereum ETFs (exchange-traded funds) will officially commence trading next week, on Tuesday, July 23, 2024. This significant development was announced by the Chicago Board Options Exchange (CBOE).
Five Spot Ethereum ETFs Go Live On Cboe Next Week
On Friday, July 19, the Chicago Board Options Exchange posted new issue notifications, disclosing the launch of highly anticipated Ether exchange-traded funds. The exchange declared that five spot Ethereum ETFs, including Fidelity (FETH), VanEck (ETHV), 21Shares (CETH), Invesco (QETH), and Franklin Templeton (EZET), are expected to launch next week Tuesday.
Each Cboe notification read:
We are pleased to announce that One (1) Exchange Traded Product (“ETP”) will be listed on Cboe an…

entry.title: DeFi Protocol Rho Markets Suffers $7.6 Million Loss Scare With Gray Hat Hackers
entry.summary:
In an interesting turn of events, Rho Markets, a lending protocol based on the Ethereum layer two networks Scroll, has had a daunting experience with grey hat hackers involving the temporary loss of $7.6 million in users’ assets.
Rho Markets’ Security Breach Exposed By Gray Hat
In an X post on Friday, Rho Markets announced they had noticed some suspicious activity on their platform, prompting them to suspend all operations and commence an investigation. The crypto lending platform assured all users that the majority of its token pools were secured, and there was no cause for concern.
Related Reading: $235 Million Crypto Theft from WazirX Was ‘Perpetrated’ By North Korean Hackers, Report Reveals
However, Cyvers Alerts revealed that Rho Markets had been compromised with the attacker…

entry.title: Rho Markets Pauses Platform After Attacker Siphons $7.6 Million in Digital Assets

entry.title: Fallout From WazirX’s $235M Exploit: Crypto Exchange Files Police Complaint
entry.summary:
After being hit by a massive hack that resulted in the loss of $235 million for its investors on Thursday, India-based cryptocurrency exchange WazirX has taken immediate steps to mitigate the damage and filed a police complaint to recover the stolen funds.
WazirX Launches Legal Pursuit
In a recent update on the situation, WazirX published a social media post noting that the exchange has reported the incident to the Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) and CERT-In, India’s Computer Emergency Response Team. The exchange stated:
In response to the cyber attack, we have filed a police complaint and are pursuing additional legal actions. We will keep the community updated as we proceed.
In addition, the exchange has reportedly contacted over 500 other crypto exchanges and asked them to …

entry.title: Bitcoin Retail Demand Is Down To 3-Year Lows, Data Reveals
entry.summary:
On-chain data shows the demand from retail investors for Bitcoin has slumped to 3-year lows, a sign that may be bearish for BTC.
Bitcoin Retail Investor Transfer Volume Has Plummeted Recently
As explained by CryptoQuant founder and CEO Ki Young Ju in a new post on X, retail investor demand has seen a sharp decline recently. The “retail investors” here refer to the smallest investors in the Bitcoin market.
The transfer volume corresponding to them is generally used to track the demand for using the cryptocurrency that’s present among any cohort. In the case of retail investors, their transactions are typically valued at less than $10,000 due to their small size.
As such, Young Ju has cited the 30-day change in the total transfer volume for transactions of this size to show what th…

During the 12-month sandbox period, Ownmali will adhere to regulatory requirements, […]

entry.title: South Korea’s New Crypto Investor Protection Law Goes Into Effect
entry.summary:
This Friday, the first South Korean crypto regulatory framework has gone into effect after the one-year preparation period. The new law requires firms in the country to comply with stricter requirements to protect investors and their assets.
South Korea’s New Crypto Regulatory Framework
On July 18, 2023, South Korea’s Financial Services Commission (FSC) passed the Virtual Asset User Protection Act to reflect “key provisions” proposed under 19 pre-existing legislative crypto bills pending at the National Assembly.
The new Crypto Act was enacted in response to the growing industry and the need to set a clear and comprehensive regulatory framework. Previously, the industry was regulated through the existing Act on Reporting and Using Specified Financial Transaction Information.
This…

entry.title: Hong Kong’s Top Virtual Bank to Offer Reserve Services to Crypto Stablecoin Issuers
entry.summary:
The largest virtual bank in Hong Kong, ZA Bank, broke new ground earlier today by offering exclusive reserve bank services to stablecoin issuers, a move in line with Hong Kong’s recent regulatory advancements in cryptocurrency.
This initiative is part of the territory’s new stablecoin licensing regime, which requires crypto stablecoin operators to deposit reserve assets with local banks.
Notably, this rule appears to “strengthen the stability” and “security” of cryptocurrency in the region. It also reflects a general trend that fintech innovation continues to be interwoven with more traditional financial regulation.
First Crypto Stablecoin Issuer Already Active
According to the report, Yuancoin has become one of those actively participating in its partnership project with ZA Bank…

With fresh optimism in the cryptocurrency sector, XRP surpassing Bitcoin in this important metric demonstrates its increasing relevance in the market.
XRP Trading Volume Smashes Bitcoin In Korea
On Thursday, XRP once again displayed its prominence in the crypto market by attracting a significant portion of the overall trading activity in South Korea. Armando Pantoja, a crypto advisor at Benzinga News Outlet, shared the positive development on the X (formerly Twitter) platform, which has caused qui…

entry.title: Bitcoin Whales Rapidly Buying, Retail Demand At A 3-Year Low
entry.summary:
Bitcoin is stable when writing, in an uptrend, and technically around all-time highs, looking at how prices have evolved over the past five years. Despite the recent contraction forcing the world’s most valuable coin to spot rates, exciting trends are developing, pointing to confidence, especially among whales.
Whales Rapidly Accumulating Bitcoin
According to the IntoTheBlock data on July 19, whales are doubling down. As data shows, the number of addresses holding at least 1,000 BTC are rapidly buying, scooping more coins and pushing the figure to a two-year high. This swell in buying pressure means that whales, mainly comprising institutions and deep-pocketed investors, are confident of Bitcoin’s long-term prospects.

Farming interest shifts to Berachain & Monad.

entry.title: What's the Meta? Meet the Solana Dev Who Suffered Third Degree Burns to Pump a Token
entry.summary:
Meet Mikol: the Dare dev that doused himself in isopropyl alcohol and had fireworks shot at him. He instantly went up in flames and was rushed to hospital, where it became apparent he suffered third degree burns.
In this episode, Mikol reflects on the biggest night of his life, details his injuries, and the grueling recovery process he’s still in. Despite the traumatic incident, Mikol isn’t done with the project. Instead, he’s planning to build a decentralized app where community members can take on dares in exchange for DARE tokens.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 156 - ETH ON THE RISE!
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$147m. ETH outperforms with ETF optimism. Germany government moves 2375 BTC again. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Trump to speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Goldman Sachs to launch 3 tokenisation projects. Realised losses similar to COVID period. Staked ETH nears ATH. CEX stablecoin volume hits 7-month low. CFTC says 70-80% of crypto not securities. Base hardfork improves compression 20-30%. BitMEX pleads guilty to AML violation. APTOS & SEI see weak attendance at ETHcc event.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 155 - ETFs SAVE THE DAY
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: $216m. $654m of inflows into ETFs over 3 days. BTC transaction fees hit 4-year low. German state moves $300m BTC, holdings $1bn. SOL flips ETH for 7d DEX volumes. SOL Firedancer sees first accepted block on testnet. Tether mints another $250m USDT on SOL. Crypto monthly active addresses tops 100m. Biden crypto veto now expected to be upheld. Tech coalition urges Biden to back crypto. People face security threats at ETHCC. DBS sees 300% growth in crypto trading. PYUSD now 7th largest stable coin. China may have already sold BTC holdings. Elliptic exposes $11bn USDT scam network. StanChart in talks to buy Howard’s crypto fund. Polychain accuses former employee of side deals. SEI leads altcoins as it launches v2 mainnet beta. TIA rises 80% from lows on short squeeze. TON to release L2 based on Polygon’s tech stack.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 154 - THE CELEBS ARE BACK...
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: +$295m. ETF inflows fight German selling, BTC unchanged. German government sells $900m BTC, moves more. Rate of sales implies German supply sold this week. ETH ETFs set to launch next week. Election may affect SOL ETF decision March 2025. Raydium beats ETH for 24hr fees. BTC ‘power law’ points to 300% gain by 2025. BTC in 80 day post-halving re-accumulation phase. BlackRock treasury fund hits $500m. Republicans release pro-crypto policy. Senate urges blockchain tests for national security. Drop in BTC mining difficulty ‘comparable to FTX’. MetaMask introduces delegation toolkit. 25 major projects to launch tokens in H2 2025.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 153 - A WEAK WEEKEND
entry.summary: BTC sinks 5% then bounces back to unchanged. $58-60k the main area for ‘shorts to defend’. Crypto funds saw $441m inflows last week. German government transfers 1000 BTC to sell. Crypto sentiment at lowest in over a year. ETH spot premium hits local highs. Japanese firm Metaplanet buys $2.5m BTC. Expect more miners merging: TeraWulf CEO. SOL Firedancer bug bounty goes live. GLM transfers $117m of ETH treasury to exchanges. 98% of coins have topped this cycle: Kang. ETH ETF should come in next 2 weeks: Geraci. Crypto progress disheartening: Copeland.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 152 - JOINED BY DEEZE!
entry.summary: BTC hits $54k, set for worst week in over year. Mt. Gox begins to move BTC & make distributions. German government continues to sell holdings. Worst day for BTC liquidations since FTX. Justin Sun says he is willing to buy German BTC. German MP calls on it to stop selling BTC. $52k super-trend support line eyed for BTC. Funding rates turn extremely negative across majors. Only 6 mining machines profitable below $56k. Coinbase spot buyers emerge to counter drop. Total3 hits RSI lows only hit 4 times in last 4 years. Fear & Greed index hits lowest since Jan 2023. Capo remains bullish. Real selling begins at $38k: Schiff. Coinbase continue to fight for Gensler’s emails. Circle mints $250m USDC on SOL. Symbiotic hits $1bn TVL. Taiwan Mobile may open crypto exchange. Unisat completes funding round with Binance.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 151 - BTC TAPS THE 60K LINE
entry.summary: BTC ETF Flows: -$14m. BTC drops to $60k, CME gap filed again. $1bn shorts liquidated if we rally to $62.6k. Pump(.)fun surpasses ETH for revenue. ETH will outperform BTC after ETF launch: K33. ETH ETF may be delayed even further. BTC heading to $150k: Fundstrat. Chainlink & Fidelity partner for fund data on-chain. USDC protects the dollar: Circle ad. Robinhood considers crypto futures in US & EU. Another BTC miner looks to IPO in US. Vitalik bullish on prediction markets. Sentient Labs raises $85m for AI on SOL. Mantra to tokenise $500m of real estate. TAO falls 15% after security breach. Crypto scams & hacks hit $572m in Q2.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 150 - BILLY TO A BILLY?
entry.summary: BTC ETF inflows hit highest in a month. ETH ETF inflows to hit $5bn in 6 months: Gemini. ETH public funds see largest outflow since 2022. SOL hits new ATH for monthly economic value. Sellers starting to look exhausted: Crypto Quant. Silvergate sued by SEC, settles for $63m. Circle gets stablecoin license for USDC in EU. US DoJ ironically chooses Coinbase for custody. Bitcoin miner aims for $16bn IPO. Bitfarms increases BTC mining amid takeover attempt. DOT has 2 year runway amid large burn. DOT ecosystem builders turn against team. PENDLE TVL falls $3bn as restaking rewards end. PayPal stablecoin goes live on Jupiter. At least $600m altcoin unlocks this month.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 149 - LUCA NETZ LIVE!
entry.summary: BTC bounces back above $61k after nosedive. SOL leads majors, BTC dominance falls. BTC RSI hit 18, largest net selling day in over a year. $174m ETF outflow led by GBTC. German government sells $24m more more BTC. Mt Gox info probably ‘leaked to insiders’. Mr 100 buys dip for first time in 34 days. SOL leads Moonpay transactions for 5th week. Trump may speak at Bitcoin Nashville. Biden rehires crypto advisor. Crypto & AI complement each other: Balaji. Bitcoin will protect AI’s wealth: Pomp. Tether stops minting on Algorand & EOS. Jupiter launches v3 swaps. ETH Foundation mailing list gets leaked. Jump CEO resigns after CFTC investigation. 54% of Japanese institutional investors want BTC. Strike launches in UK. MiCA approved EUR stablecoins coming in 6 days.

entry.title: Transhumanism and the Quest for Immortality with SingularityNET CEO Dr. Ben Goertzel
entry.summary: Transhumanism is a philosophical and intellectual movement that advocates the enhancement of the human condition using technologies that can increase longevity, cognition, and well-being. In this interview, SingularityNET founder and CEO Dr. Ben Goertzel discusses his background in the transhumanist movement and how AI, and AGI will play a part.

entry.title: Vivendi Web3 Lead: 'There's No Ethical GenAI if You Don't Protect Content'
entry.summary: Fabien Aufrechter, VP of Web 3.0 at Vivendi, joined Rug Radio's Farokh aboard the Joker Odyssey at Cannes Lions to discuss the media group's plans for a global digital copyright, and how token-gated media will lead to the end of third-party cookies.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 148 - SOL ETF NARRATIVE DOMINATES
entry.summary: SOL leads majors as Van Eck files for ETF. Bitwise hints at SOL ETF filing. SOL will get ETF, ADA & XRP won’t: GSR. SOL price may rise 8.9x with ETF: GSR. Coinbase & Stripe team up for onboarding. BTC miner sell pressure weakens. BTC activity drops to lowest level in 10 years. Steve Cohen shuts down crypto arm of hedge fund. Crypto unmentioned in Presidential debate. Kraken co-founder donates $1m to Trump. Bolivia lifts BTC ban. MegaLabs raises $20m, aims for 100k TPS.

entry.title: FOMO HOUR 147 - THE BLAST FALLOUT
entry.summary: Crypto bounces, ETFs see another small net inflow. The US government sends 3940 BTC to exchanges. Spot ETH ETFs may be coming July 4th. Coinbase sues SEC over FOIA inquiries. Most ‘obvious & attractive’ buying opp possible. US man convicted of home invasions to steal BTC. Blast launches at $2.5bn FDV, disappoints many. ADA faces DDoS attacks with 200 transactions. Losses from deep fakes could hit $24bn in 2024. Miners face M&A boom on AI retrofitting. Marathon mines $16M KAS. Vitalik introduces ZK voting company Rarimo. Animoca Brands considers public listing.
